The feedback is based on the video I've just watched.

While the caption correctly identifies the main action and subjects, it could be more precise about their spatial relationships and the dynamics of the camera movement. The initial depth of the two silhouetted figures is not specified; it only places the central figure in the middle ground. It would be clearer to state that the silhouetted figures are in the foreground, which would better explain why the left figure remains there as the camera advances. The description of the central figure walking "away" is also slightly misleading, as the camera's forward movement keeps them at a relatively consistent distance, causing the shot to tighten from a medium shot to a medium close-up, rather than having the figure recede into the background. Furthermore, describing the left figure as simply "partially visible" undersells the visual effect; as the camera dollies forward, this foreground figure creates a parallax effect, wiping across the left edge of the frame. A more accurate description would clarify the initial foreground position of the side figures and describe the camera's movement as a dolly-in that overtakes the subject's walking pace, creating the tightening frame and the parallax motion of the foreground element.
